Figures

Class GeometryUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • Figures.GeometryUtils

  • public class GeometryUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Class with utility methods for solving geometric problems. Provides methods for vector normalization, orientation checks, and segment intersection. Author: Daniel Pantyukhov a83896 Gustavo Silva a83994 Alexandre Goncalves a83892 Version: 1.0 (12/04/25)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GeometryUtils() 

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Point normalize(Point p)
      Normalizes a vector represented as a Point.
      static boolean onSegment(Point p, Point q, Point r)
      Used when line segments are collinear and we need to check if they overlap.
      static int orientation(Point p, Point q, Point r)
      Checks the orientation of a point r relative to the line segment formed by p1 and p2.

      • GeometryUtils

        public GeometryUtils()

    • Method Detail

      • normalize

        public static Point normalize(Point p)
        Normalizes a vector represented as a Point.
        Parameters:
        p - the vector to normalize
        Returns:
        a new Point representing the normalized vector

      • orientation

        public static int orientation(Point p,
                              Point q,
                              Point r)
        Checks the orientation of a point r relative to the line segment formed by p1 and p2.
        Parameters:
        p - starting point of the segment
        q - ending point of the segment
        r - point to be checked
        Returns:
        0 if the points are collinear, 1 if r is to the left of the segment, and 2 if r is to the right of the segment
        See Also:
        https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/orientation-3-ordered-points/

      • onSegment

        public static boolean onSegment(Point p,
                                Point q,
                                Point r)
        Used when line segments are collinear and we need to check if they overlap.
        Parameters:
        p - start of a segment
        q - end of a segment
        r - point to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the point r is on the segment, false otherwise
